com.ge.predix.mobile.core

Class PushReplicationFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ge.predix.mobile.core.PushReplicationFilter

  • public abstract class PushReplicationFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by 212460388 on 1/31/17.
    Copyright Â© 2016 GE. All rights reserved.
    Filters are used by push replicators to choose which documents to synced back. For an example assume a general use case where the need was to filter all documents with "type" equal to "vehicle". The Java code would define and add a push replication filter like so: 
     @Override
 private void createPushFilter() {
      PushReplicationFilter filter = new PushReplicationFilter() {
          public boolean filterFunction(Map<String, Object> document, Map<String, Object> parameters) {
              String docTypeParam = (String) parameters.get("type");
              //simply returns true to allow the document to be replicated, or false to prevent it from being replicated.
              return docTypeParam != null && docTypeParam.equals(document.get("type"));
          }
      };
      String filterName = "typeFilter";
      PredixMobileConfiguration.addNewFilter(filterName, filter);
      PredixMobileConfiguration.defaultPushReplicationFilterName = filterName;
 }

 This would need to be done prior to starting with MobileManager

 Then the JavaScript code would create a request like the following:
 http://pmapi//cdb/replication/push
 Body {
     "filter":"typeFilter",
     "parameters": {"type":"vehicle"}
 }
    This call would activate the filter with the parameters from the request body. Each new/updated document in the Predix mobile data store would run through the filter which would receive the parameters from the JavaScript code. The filter compares the properties of each document to the parameters given from JavaScript.

      abstract boolean filterFunction(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> document, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
      True if the document revision should be included in the pushed replication, otherwise false.

    • Method Detail

      • filterFunction

        public abstract boolean filterFunction(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> document,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        True if the document revision should be included in the pushed replication, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        document - An update or new Map document to be considered for exclusion by the filter
        params - A Map of parameters given by the activating JavaScript.
        Returns:
        returns true if the given document should be included, false otherwise.
